name: Format\ArticleTitle
description: The component for displaying an article title in the ArticleLink component.

properties.name: anchor
properties.description: An object that defines vertical alignment with another component.

properties.name: animation
properties.description:
An object that defines an animation to be applied to the component.
The none value is used for conditional design elements. Adding it here has no effect.

properties.name: behavior
properties.description:
An object that defines behavior for a component, like  or .
The none value is used for conditional design elements. Adding it here has no effect.

properties.name: conditional
properties.description: An instance or array of text properties that can be applied conditionally, and the conditions that cause them to be applied.

properties.name: format
properties.description:
The formatting or markup method applied to the text. 
Valid values:
Inline styling and additions with ranges (using inlineTextStyles and additions properties) are only supported when format is none.

properties.name: hidden
properties.description: A Boolean value that determines whether the component is hidden.

properties.name: identifier
properties.description: A unique identifier for this component. If used, the identifier must be unique across the entire document. An identifier is required if you want to anchor other components to this component. See .

properties.name: inlineTextStyles
properties.description:
An array of InlineTextStyle objects you can use to apply different text styles to ranges of text. For each InlineTextStyle object, supply rangeStart and rangeLength values, and either a  object or the identifier of a text style that is defined at the top level of the document.
Inline text styles are ignored when the format is set to markdown or html.
The none value is used for conditional design elements. Adding it here has no effect.

properties.name: layout
properties.description:
Either an inline ComponentLayout object that contains layout information, or a string reference to a ComponentLayout object that is defined at the top level of the document.
If layout is not defined, size and position are based on various factors, such as the device type, the length of the content, and the role of this component.

properties.name: style
properties.description:
An inline ComponentStyle object that defines the appearance of this component, or a string reference to a ComponentStyle object that is defined at the top level of the document.
The none value is used for conditional design elements. Adding it here has no effect.

properties.name: text
properties.description: The text, styled according to the textStyle definition. You can also use a subset of HTML syntax by setting format to html. See .

properties.name: textStyle
properties.description: An inline ComponentTextStyle object that contains styling information, or a string reference to a ComponentTextStyle object that is defined at the top level of the document.
